data.headline: Senior Advisor at The Blackstone Group
data.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States, North America
data.about:
Senior Executive: Technology Real Estate, IT Platform Services & Communications
High performance executive with more than 30 years of success developing and executing growth and go-to-market strategies for technology platform & IT solutions companies in competitive global markets. Broad scope of general management and P&L leadership experience with mid-sized companies and multi-billion global companies driving significant operating efficiencies. 
- Corporate sales, marketing, product and business development leader with a strong network of senior executive relationships with clients, investors, industry analysts and partners throughout the communications and IT Industry.
- Expert in transforming go-to-market strategy, execution and messaging in the integrated communications, data center,  and cloud services industry - from concept to creating digital strategies,  defining tactics and instilling a customer-centric culture of purpose and passion to execute the vision from "Campaign to Cash"
- Mergers and acquisitions and integration leader valued at over $12B in the last 12 years.
- Investment due diligence for leading private equity and technology companies for $2.3B in GPUasS, $10B+ in Data Center Platform US, Plus Global Projects in Japan, India, SE Asia, China/HK, Africa, EMEA, LATAM & US including JVs

data.headline: CVP, Commercial Solution Areas @ Microsoft | Product excellence. Community builder. Leader in cloud innovation. Change agent. Champion for allyship and belonging.
data.location: Seattle, Washington, United States, North America
data.about:
I am a technology leader who is passionate about transforming and scaling businesses, creating customer-centric products, building inclusive and collaborative teams. 

I currently lead the go-to-market and solution sales functions, with responsibility over the six Solution Areas of the Microsoft Cloud (Azure Infrastructure, Data & AI, Digital & App Innovation, Modern Work, Business Applications, and Security) delivering $100B+ in annual commercial revenue. The Commercial Solution Areas team defines the solutions that Microsoft offers, and facilitates conversations with customers about the purpose, capability, and value of these solutions at scale. We also represent the voice of the customer and channel it internally to influence product roadmaps and solution offerings. This work ensures the Microsoft Cloud is continuously optimized for customers to realize business value in a dynamic marketplace.  

I’ve spent 26 years of my career in product engineering at Microsoft. Most recently, I led product and design for Azure Infrastructure, delivering infrastructure offerings that power the world’s workloads. I’m a platform and systems builder at heart, contributing to more than 15 operating system releases in various product leadership positions at Microsoft. 

One of my favorite projects was helping to transform the Program Management discipline, creating specialized roles and career paths including Product Management, Technical Program Management and Customer Experience Program Management roles. Through this work, we were able to provide greater clarity and industry alignment for thousands of roles within the company, simplify recruiting for HR, and better support our employees’ career growth, mobility, and business impact.

This work underscores my belief that the greatest source of strength for any organization is its people. In every role, I am intentional about building solid, healthy teams, creating connection and community, and enriching team culture with inclusion and allyship. It is important to me that people feel comfortable to be themselves at work, and have the freedom and support to bring their best ideas forward.

Originally from Canada, I am naturally a huge hockey fan, and split my loyalties between the Vancouver Canucks and Seattle Kraken. When not at work, I love traveling and learning about new cultures, cooking to rejuvenate my energy, and planning elaborate Halloween costumes with my family.

data.headline: President and CEO
data.location: Atherton, California, United States, North America
data.about:
My mission is to help companies (both large and small) develop strategies to achieve sustainable growth. 

As President and CEO of Virtana, the Deepest and Broadest Observability Platform, we enable the performance and availability of critical business services as well as driving operational efficiency for many of the Global 2000. 

Previously, as Interim Chief Revenue Officer at Spring Health, I drove the transformation that doubled both ARR and revenues in 2023, signing multiple 8 figure ACV deals with Fortune 500 companies and grew the team to over 1,000 employees.  I also rebuilt the leadership team (CMO, SVP Revenue Operations and Strategy, VP Sales and leader of Customer Success), deployed a new operational model and redesigned the GTM strategy.  

In the past, I have driven similar transformations as President at ElasticSearch (growing revenues from $500M to over $1B) and CEO of Kinetica (an AI and advanced analytics company). For more than 20 years, I have successfully built and led global teams at C3 AI, BMC Software, Salesforce, Travelex, Siebel, and SAP.

In my spare time, I advise the Board of the John Maclean Foundation, serve as an advisor to a number of early and growth stage start ups, serve on the board of the Design Tech High School and enjoy surfing, skiing, and cycling.

Proven success developing sales strategy and driving revenue with early stage start-ups to established enterprise technology companies, demonstrating professional and cultural adaptability.

- Channels OEM, SaaS, MSSP and VAR
-  Application Security, RPA, DPA, Digital Transformation, Dev/Sec/Ops, IOT, AI, Machine Learning, Microservices, Virtualization, Cloud,  Big Data, Analytics, Storage, Database, E-Discovery, SDN, System Networking
- Markets: Tech Startups, Financial Services, Insurance , Pharma and Life Sciences, TeleComms, Legal, Entertainment, State and Local Government
- Enterprise Accounts: Bank of America, Citibank, JP Morgan Chase, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Fidelity, NYC, Merck, Pfizer, Time Warner, Comcast, Verizon, GE, Novartis, CBS, Viacom, Altice, NYSE, NASDAQ, FannieMae, FreddieMac, Federal Reserve, J&J, Roche, Biogen, Regeneron, Merck, Pfizer

data.headline: Early-Stage Investor, Advisor, Board Member, LP • Former SaaS Founder + Operator • Rare Disease Mamá + Fighter
data.location: San Francisco, California, United States, North America
data.about: I'm a systems-thinking SaaS leader turned venture capitalist, driven by a passion for growing people and organizations. I previously co-founded an e-learning SaaS platform in Barcelona, and after seven years of building my career and community abroad, I moved to San Francisco to open Typeform’s first U.S. office. Throughout my career, I’ve held leadership roles at hyper-growth SaaS startups, where I built and operationalized teams from the ground up. As an investor, I’m drawn to startups where technology meets human connection, focusing on maximizing returns while staying true to the triple-bottom line: profits, people, and process.

data.headline: Managing Partner, Insurance Solutions Group
data.location: Highland Park, Illinois, United States, North America
data.about:
P&C insurance technology, IoT/Connected Car, Home and claims ecosytem strategic consultant, industry analyst, advisor, serial entrepreneur and seasoned corporate executive with a results-charged, 20+year career that reflects consistent achievements in starting, building, growing and improving the profitability, performance and value of businesses.

Contributed to several successful Claims Information technology companies, two of which were became >$200M businesses, and were subsequently sold. As a corporate executive, built in less than 5 years a  successful start-up in the online claims supply chain management space.

Successful in driving the fast, time-critical deployment and implementation of down to earth scaleable management systems ( operations processes and performance measurement systems, software projects, development and productizing. Able to create and lead strong teams that have a common vision and deliver exceptional results. Maintains a strong work ethic and a positive attitude at all times. Entrepreneurial spirit and edge for success. 

Established strategic consultancy practice for North American P&C carriers and supply chain participants.

International experience including Canadian market. In-depth knowledge of several verticals surrounding auto physical damage and property claims process including collison repair, alternative parts procurement, insurance replacement car rental, independent appraisal and adjusting, salvage and litigation defense.

Specialties: Information Technology applied to Property & Casualty insurance claim process improvement, Connected Devices and supply chain management through innovation.

data.headline: Co-Founder at The Growth Foundation - exCMO at Gymshark and CEO THG Ingenuity, scaling both companies to unicorn valuations. Now helping brands growth the right way with strategy & talent services.
data.location: London, England, United Kingdom, Europe
data.about:
Former CMO at Gymshark and CEO at THG Ingenuity, scaling both companies to unicorn valuations.

Also served as Head of Marketing at Play.com (acquired by Rakuten), driving growth across digital retail.

Currently Co-founder & CGO of The Growth Foundation, helping scale high-potential brands across sectors.

Advisor to DTC startups including Ruroc (£100M+), Bother, Snug, and Health & Her, unlocking sustainable, profitable growth.

Worked with brands like Unilever, Nintendo, PepsiCo, and The Walt Disney Company on eComm & marketing execution.

Things I can advise on:
✔️ How to build a DTC brand
✔️ Customer lifetime value strategies
✔️ Conversion rate optimization
✔️ Scale up guidance & strategy
✔️ Fundraising & investor positioning
✔️ Launching a go-to-market strategy
✔️ Scaling eComm & subscriptions
✔️ Team & org design for growth
✔️ Exit prep & private equity readiness

Passionate about helping founders scale with confidence and avoid the hidden traps that stall real growth.

data.headline: Co-Founder & President, Sport Media Entertainment • Former CEO at SABR • Former Senior Executive, Editor & Writer at ESPN, AOL Sports, Fox Sports, WWE, Active, SI for Kids, LA Times
data.location: Naples, Florida, United States, North America
data.about:
Innovative sports executive with extensive experience developing and implementing a strategic vision and leading and managing organizations, with a special emphasis on generating growth and business development. 

Co-Founder & President of Sport Media Entertainment Inc. Former CEO at SABR (Society for American Baseball Research) and Senior Executive, Editor, Writer and Producer at ESPN, Fox Sports, AOL Sports, Sports Illustrated for Kids, WWE, Active and Nobok Sports.

Was an Adjunct Professor at the George Polk School of Communications at LIU, Feb-May 2021, and a guest lecturer at The Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication at ASU.

data.headline: Credit Risk Management | Sustainable Finance and Investment | Debt Capital Market
data.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States, North America
data.about: Apple is a credit analyst with experience assigning ratings to U.S. tax-back and special revenue bonds, as well as corporate bonds in the U.S and Asia. She has formal training in sustainable finance and investment (ESG, impact investment, green evaluation) and has been incorporating these factors in her investment analysis. As a veteran credit analyst at S&P, head of ratings advisory at a global investment bank, and head of credit risk at an insurance company, Apple is also a results-oriented leader with experience in managing diverse team members to accomplish business goals. She is a certified executive coach and six sigma green belt certified project manager in leading workshops, working across all organizational levels to achieve common goals, and bridging cross-cultural relationships. Apple has a master's degree from Harvard University and is a native speaker in English, Mandarin Chinese, and Cantonese. She has worked and lived in both Asia and the U.S.

data.headline: Experienced Technical and Product Management
data.about:
30 years experience in high tech optoelectronic businesses including industrial lasers, telecom components and sensors. Senior level management and commercial experience and achievement in Engineering, Operations and Product Marketing. My key interests are in technology and innovation, bringing new ideas and products to commercial reality. 

A proven track record in managing new technology development, product and process design for scalable manufacturing, with significant contributions to the start-up and early growth phase of technology companies in telecoms and industrial sectors, both in the UK and overseas.

Successful Product Line Manager with global key customer management and applications expertise across medical, automotive, printing and general manufacturing sectors in Asia, Europe and the Americas, understanding market trends, customer requirements, new business development.

data.headline: Multidisciplinary scientist and technologist
data.about: Experienced multidisciplinary scientist with a proven track record of innovation. A passionate problem solver possessing a very strong mathematical and analytical background with significant strengths in information theory, probability theory, and statistics. A software engineer, fluent and experienced at programming in all major languages. A hardware engineer with both front-end and back-end digital experience, analogue, and clean room and characterisation experience. Accomplished researcher and developer in the area of microprocessor design and contributor to the global IEEE standard for floating-point arithmetic (IEEE 754r).

data.headline: Regional Asset Protection Manager | Security | Multi-Unit Management | Safety
data.location: Elko New Market, Minnesota, United States, North America
data.about: Experienced leader in asset protection and safety with a focus on building strong teams, driving compliance, and fostering a culture of security. At Victoria’s Secret & Co., I oversee multi-unit safety strategies, crisis management, and training programs to ensure operational excellence. Previously at Amazon, I led community-based crisis response efforts, enhanced logistics safety and investigations. I’m passionate about proactive safety leadership and creating secure, high-performing environments.

data.headline: Six Sigma Master Black Belt, Lean Six Sigma Black Belt, CCMP, Prosci ADKAR®
data.about: I help organizations lead meaningful change by putting people at the center. With over 25 years of management consulting experience and deep expertise in Change Management and Transformation Leadership, I’ve guided diverse teams through complex, lasting transformations. I craft strategies that resonate, build tailored roadmaps rooted in each organization’s culture, and amplify engagement through inclusive, human-centered leadership. The research is clear: lasting change happens when people feel empowered, connected, and energized about the journey. That belief is at the heart of my work. I am a Board-Certified Coach, Change Practitioner, and Six Sigma Master Black Belt with a proven track record in Program and Project Management, Process Improvement, Risk Management, Strategic Planning, HR Leadership, Organizational Change, and Training and Development. I’ve led large cross-functional initiatives across industries, with a strong focus on mergers, acquisitions, and cultural integration. My career foundation was built at GE, where I spent 17 years in a variety of leadership roles. I’m a master trainer and facilitator of GE’s Work-Out and Change Acceleration Process (CAP) models, and I was a pilot member of GE Capital’s elite Advanced Leadership and Facilitation Network (ALFN). I played a central role in launching Six Sigma within the business and am fully certified to teach the methodology and its tools at both the Black Belt and Master Black Belt levels. My specialties include: • Project & Program Management • Six Sigma & LEAN Quality Management • Organizational Change Management • Executive Coaching • Cultural Integration • Mergers & Acquisitions • Talent Management & Succession Planning • Training & Development • Risk Management
